April 9, 2014 Melbourne, Aus

Michael Mifsud @xzyfer

Published 8th Apr

Introducing: Chris Eppstein

We’re excited to announce, hot off the long anticipated release of Sass 3.3, Chris Eppstein (@chriseppstein) to round off our list of invited speakers.

Arguably Sass has improved the way we think about CSS, which is why we’re elated that Chris has taken time away from his work at LinkedIn to join us in Melbourne and share “What makes Sass so syntactically awesome.”

You undoubtably know him as the creator of Compass, and co-creator of Sass. He’s built and contributed to many of Sass’ powerful features. But I’ll personally always be thankful to him for fixing Sass’ if statement.

We can’t wait to have Chris Eppstein with us at the first ever CSSConf Australia.

CSSConf Australia is a one-day conference to bring together the designers and developers creating the future face of the web
